com.isoterik.mgdx.io

Class GameAssetsLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.isoterik.mgdx.io.GameAssetsLoader

  • public final class GameAssetsLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    For loading and managing game assets. This class uses AssetManager internally for handling assets. Assets can be loaded either synchronously or asynchronously.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager assetManager 
      protected boolean loadAssetsInBackground 
      protected java.lang.Runnable onLoadAssets

      • instance

        public static GameAssetsLoader instance()
        Returns:
        a single instance of the loader

      • setLoader

        public <T,P extends com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetLoaderParameters<T>> void setLoader(java.lang.Class<T> assetClass,
                                                                                     com.badlogic.gdx.assets.loaders.AssetLoader<T,P> loader)
        Sets a custom asset loader. Loaders for common assets like Textures, BitmapFonts etc are already set for you automatically. Use this to set loaders for your custom asset.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of asset
        P - the type of the loader parameters
        Parameters:
        assetClass - the class of the asset
        loader - the loader

      • getLoader

        public <T> com.badlogic.gdx.assets.loaders.AssetLoader getLoader(java.lang.Class<T> assetClass)
        Returns the default loader for the given asset class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the asset type
        Parameters:
        assetClass - the asset class
        Returns:
        The loader capable of loading the type, or null if none exists

      • getLoader

        public <T> com.badlogic.gdx.assets.loaders.AssetLoader getLoader(java.lang.Class<T> assetClass,
                                                                 java.lang.String filePath)
        Returns the loader for the given type and the specified filename. If no loader exists for the specific filename, the default loader for that type is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The loader capable of loading the type and filename, or null if none exists
        Parameters:
        assetClass - the asset class
        filePath - The filePath of the asset to get a loader for, or null to get the default loader
        Returns:
        the loader for the asset or null if none exists

        Sets an AssetErrorListener to be invoked in case loading an asset failed
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener. Can be null

      • getLoadedAssetsCount

        public int getLoadedAssetsCount()
        Returns:
        the number of loaded assets

      • loadAssetsInBackground

        public void loadAssetsInBackground(java.lang.Runnable onLoadAssets)
        Loads the queued assets asynchronously in the background. Takes a runnable that will be executed when the loading is completed. After calling this method you need to continuously call update() to progress loading and invoke the passed runnable when done with loading.
        Parameters:
        onLoadAssets - a runnable to invoke the number of loaded assets. Can be null

      • update

        public void update()
        Calling this method progresses the loading process. You'll typically call this method after calling loadAssetsInBackground.

      • enqueueTexture

        public void enqueueTexture(java.lang.String filePath)
        Adds an asset to the queue of assets that needs to be loaded. Note: this doesn't load the asset, this simply enqueue the asset, loading is deferred until either loadAssetsInBackground(Runnable), loadAssetsNow() or loadAssetNow(String) is called.
        Parameters:
        filePath - a path to the asset file

      • enqueueSfxFolder

        public void enqueueSfxFolder(java.lang.String folderPath)
        A convenient method for enqueuing Music and Sound assets inside a folder. Files with '.mp3' extensions are assumed to be Music files and others are assumed to be Sound files. Assets are not enqueued recursively, only the top level assets are considered. For a recursive approach use enqueueFolderContents(String, Class) instead. Note: this doesn't load the assets, this simply enqueue the assets, loading is deferred until either loadAssetsInBackground(Runnable), loadAssetsNow() or loadAssetNow(String) is called.
        Parameters:
        folderPath - path to the folder containing the assets

      • enqueueFolderContents

        public <T> void enqueueFolderContents(java.lang.String folderPath,
                                      java.lang.Class<T> assetClass)
        A convenient method for loading all the similar assets in a folder. Assets are enqueued recursively so any sub-folder must have assets of a similar type. Note: this doesn't load the assets, this simply enqueue the assets, loading is deferred until either loadAssetsInBackground(Runnable), loadAssetsNow() or loadAssetNow(String) is called.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of asset
        Parameters:
        folderPath - path to the folder
        assetClass - the asset class

      • enqueueAsset

        public <T> void enqueueAsset(java.lang.String path,
                             java.lang.Class<T> assetClass)
        Enqueues an asset of the specified type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - asset type
        Parameters:
        path - path to asset
        assetClass - asset class

      • enqueueSkin

        public void enqueueSkin(java.lang.String jsonPath)
        Convenient method for enqueueing Skin assets
        Parameters:
        jsonPath - path to the JSON file of the skin

      • enqueueAtlas

        public void enqueueAtlas(java.lang.String path)
        Convenient method for enqueuing TextureAtlas assets
        Parameters:
        path - path to the atlas pack file

      • tickLoader

        public boolean tickLoader()
        Updates the loader for a single task. Returns if the current task is still being processed or there are no tasks, otherwise it finishes the current task and starts the next task.
        Returns:
        true if all loading is finished

      • getProgressPercentage

        public float getProgressPercentage()
        Returns:
        the progress in percent of completion on a scale of [0 - 100]

      • loadAssetsNow

        public void loadAssetsNow()
        Blocks until all queued assets are loaded. This loads synchronously. For asynchronous loading use loadAssetsInBackground(Runnable) instead.

      • loadAssetNow

        public void loadAssetNow(java.lang.String assetName)
        Blocks until the specified asset is loaded. This wont load other queued assets. Use loadAssetsNow() to load all queued assets. This loads synchronously. For asynchronous loading use loadAssetsInBackground(Runnable) instead.
        Parameters:
        assetName - the name/path of the asset file to load

      • isFinishedLoading

        public boolean isFinishedLoading()
        Returns:
        true when all assets are loaded. Can be called from any thread but note tickLoader() or related methods must be called to process tasks

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded(java.lang.String filePath)
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the asset file
        Returns:
        true if the specified asset is loaded, false otherwise

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded(java.lang.String filePath,
                        java.lang.Class assetClass)
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the asset file
        assetClass - the asset class
        Returns:
        true if the specified asset is loaded, false otherwise

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String filePath)
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the asset file
        Returns:
        true if an asset with the specified name is loading, queued to be loaded, or has been loaded

                                                    boolean applyLinearFilter)

        applyLinearFilter - if true linear Texture.TextureFilter will be applied, else nearest will be applied
        Returns:
        the texture
